name: Momofuku's Ginger-Scallion Noodles with Tofu
description: Adapted from The Art of Simple Food. [Photograph: Blake Royer] About the author: Blake Royer is a food writer, photographer, and filmmaker based in Chicago; he has been writing for Serious Eats since 2007. You can follow him on Twitter...
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 cups thinly sliced or shredded scallions (about 1 to 2 large bunches)
1/2 cup finely minced peeled fresh ginger
1/2 cup grapeseed or other neutral oil, divided
2 tablespoons soy sauce, preferably usukuchi (light soy sauce), divided
3/4 teaspoon kosher salt, or more to taste
1 pound firm tofu, cut into 1-inch wide planks

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, mix together the scallions, ginger, 1/4 cup of the oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons of the soy sauce, vinegar, and salt. Cover the tofu with the remaining soy sauce and set aside. Allow to sit at room temperature for 15 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium until shimmering. Add the tofu and cook until golden, about 4 minutes total, turning the pieces once. Transfer tofu to a paper towel-lined plate, then cook noodles according to package directions.
Drain the noodles and toss them with the ginger scallion sauce in a large bowl. Transfer to individual bowls and top with the tofu. Serve with sriracha, if desired.
